p: The comparison of the pure essential oils demonstrated that C. cassia oil had a larger inhibition zone (38 mm) than O. dubium oil (30 mm). The inhibition zone of the pure essential oil of C. cassia against clinically isolated human S. mutans was measured as 19 mm in a previous study by Chaudhry and Tariq [ 77]. This variation with our results may be due to the differences in the active ingredient ratios of the essential oils.
